security_audit.summary: This is legitimate Git worktree management documentation. All 53 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. The patterns detected (shell commands, filesystem paths) are standard git operations with hardcoded arguments in documentation format. The 'C2 keywords' alerts are triggered by common computing terms like 'command' and 'control' in version control context. The 'weak cryptographic algorithm' alerts misinterpret text content (SHA256 hashes, words like 'encrypt') as code. This skill teaches safe git practices with proper safety verification using git check-ignore.

content.value_statement: Develop multiple features in parallel without git branch switching. This skill creates clean, isolated worktrees with automatic project setup and test baseline verification.
actual_capabilities: Create isolated git worktrees in project-local or global directories
Auto-detect worktree directory from CLAUDE.md or user preference
Verify worktree directories are gitignored before creation
Auto-run project setup commands based on detected project type
Run test baseline verification after worktree creation
Report worktree location and test status for feature implementation
limitations: Cannot create worktrees from bare repositories
Project setup assumes standard file patterns (package.json, Cargo.toml, go.mod)

best_practices: Always verify worktree directories are gitignored before creation
Use project-local directories (.worktrees/) when possible for proximity
Run test baseline to ensure worktree starts in a known good state
Follow the priority: existing directories > CLAUDE.md preference > user choice
anti_patterns: Skipping git check-ignore verification for project-local directories
Proceeding with worktree creation when tests fail without user consent
Hardcoding setup commands instead of auto-detecting project type
Assuming directory location without checking existing conventions

faq.question: What is a git worktree?
faq.answer: Git worktrees create additional working trees that share the same repository, allowing parallel branch work without git checkout.

faq.question: Why use project-local over global worktrees?
faq.answer: Project-local keeps worktrees with the codebase. Global works across projects but requires path navigation.

faq.question: Does this work with any git project?
faq.answer: Requires git 2.5+. Works with all git hosting platforms including GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket.

faq.question: What happens if tests fail?
faq.answer: Reports failures and asks whether to proceed or investigate before starting feature work.

faq.question: How does safety verification work?
faq.answer: Uses git check-ignore to confirm the worktree directory is gitignored, preventing accidental commits.

faq.question: Can I customize the worktree location?
faq.answer: Yes, add worktree directory preference to CLAUDE.md or choose when prompted.
